image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A national Aboriginal children's advocacy body is calling on the NT government not to proceed with changes to child protection law that aim to make it easier for courts to place Indigenous children in non-Indigenous placements.

title.children: Planned changes to NT child protection law branded 'discriminatory'

image.altText: Exterior of pizza shop with sunset in background

props.synopsis: A summer police operation in the small NT town of Katherine has led to 200 arrests in just six weeks.

title.children: Almost 200 arrested over six-week police blitz in NT outback town

image.altText: An illegal fishing boat burns

props.synopsis: The Australian Border Force has intercepted three foreign fishing vessels and arrested 18 crew members in the latest illegal fishing boat incursion into northern waters.

title.children: Three foreign fishing boats intercepted off NT amid 'unprecedented surge'

image.altText: A storm rolls over Darwin.

props.synopsis: The monsoon's arrival in the Top End has been especially late this year. A meteorologist explains what has led to the delay.

title.children: 'Something strange is happening': Why the NT's monsoon is late this year

image.altText: A bolt of lightning in the distance of a night sky creates a hue of yellow and sheds light over rural bushland

props.synopsis: A tropical cyclone is expected to form off WA's northern coast on Sunday, but a coastal crossing remains unlikely.

title.children: Residents urged to prepare as cyclone watch issued for WA's Pilbara coast

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence

props.synopsis: As prisoner numbers in the Northern Territory continue to climb, room in the prisons is running out. A facility dedicated to some of the most vulnerable inmates is now being used to house general population prisoners.

title.children: Calls for ‘urgent review’ of treatment of NT's mentally ill prisoners

image.altText: A photo of a gas exploration project. The image is taken by a drone and shows a busy mine.

props.synopsis: Native title lawyers and environmentalists are warning the NT's proposed Territory Coordinator bill could erode Indigenous land rights and open the door to nuclear waste storage in the territory.

title.children: Warnings planned new NT law could erode Indigenous and pastoralist rights

image.altText: An empty bottle of hand sanitiser on light brown first covered with small sticks

props.synopsis: Community leaders in Alice Springs say they are concerned drinking hand sanitiser has become an ongoing problem for the town's most vulnerable people. Some experts are calling for greater regulations around the sale of the product.

title.children: Drinking hand sanitiser an ongoing problem for most vulnerable in Alice Springs

image.altText: A man in a grey hoodie walks past a wall papered with red signs saying 'bring them home now' and images of Israeli hostages

props.synopsis: A list of 33 people to be released as part of Sunday's ceasefire agreement does not confirm who of the hostages are alive or dead.

title.children: 'A complicated trauma': What we know about the Israeli hostages listed for release from Gaza

image.altText: police and forensics at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a home in the Logan suburb of Kingston on Saturday morning after reports of a domestic violence disturbance.

title.children: Man charged with attempted after woman allegedly set on fire

image.altText: A Taiwan national flag flutters near the Taipei 101 building at the National Dr Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hall in Taipei

props.synopsis: Taiwan carried out its first execution in five years and the first under President Lai Ching-te, upsetting rights groups and the European Union.

title.children: Taiwan carries out first execution in five years

image.altText: A lit up sign for TikTok on the side of a building in the US.

props.synopsis: The fate of TikTok has been in the spotlight recently, with users in the United States bracing themselves for the looming ban of the Chinese-owned app. This is what we know.

title.children: Tik Tok could be banned in the US. Here's what Australians can expect

image.altText: A hand using a myki card

props.synopsis: The Department of Transport has confirmed it is looking into claims that a train passenger was assaulted by ticket inspectors at Middle Footscray Station.

title.children: Vic government investigating alleged assault by Melbourne train officers

image.altText: A phone box with a bright orange roof sits on a dirt road with bushland and a windmill behind it.

props.synopsis: At the entrance to Cobra Station in WA's Gascoyne, a remote phone box is still being used hundreds of times each year.

title.children: 'They tried to take it away': The successful fight to save a much-loved outback phone box

image.altText: storm front that hit Gungahlin, Canberra Jan 15

props.synopsis: Australia's summer weather is firing on all cylinders this weekend, with severe storms in the east set to make way for heatwaves in the west, and what could be the first cyclone to form near mainland Australia this season.

title.children: Fresh round of heatwaves expected to spread from west to east next week

image.altText: A model of a brain

props.synopsis: About 2,000 people in Australia are affected by Huntington's disease, a fatal and incurable condition that affects the nervous system that results in the death of brain cells.

title.children: Research reveals 'ticking DNA clock' behind Huntington's disease

image.altText: Dutton, with a blonde woman in a blue suit jacket, talk in front of a supermarket deli counter

props.synopsis: The Coalition seems to be relying on the disgruntlement of voters with the government over tough times, rather than actively producing serious policies to do anything about it.

title.children: Dutton can't dodge the spotlight — or his unresolved problems

image.altText: Actress Joan Plowright poses for a portrait at a New York hotel on May 4, 1999

props.synopsis: One of Britain's most celebrated screen and stage actors has died surrounded by her loved ones.

title.children: UK theatre and film legend Joan Plowright dies, aged 95

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Lisa standing in grassland, with native trees behind her.

props.synopsis: In the middle of Tasmania sits a 5,000-hectare property once used for sheep grazing. But when the sheep farmers left, an unlikely buyer moved in.

title.children: Billionaire couple focus their fortune on conservation — and profit

image.altText: dust meteorite on pape4r

props.synopsis: A doorbell camera on a Canadian home captured rare video and sound of a meteorite striking Earth as it crashed into a couple’s walkway.

title.children: Meteorite strike captured on video by doorbell camera in Canada

image.altText: A man in a green top and blue jeans rubbing his eyes with his forearm on a backdrop of rubble and blackened trees

props.synopsis: As firefighters continue to battle the blazes bearing down on Los Angeles, some residents left in their wake have begun assessing what's next.

title.children: 'Unimaginable heartbreak': counting the toll of the Los Angeles fires

image.altText: A graphic depicts traditional Korean hanbok alongside a Chinese garment and the War Memorial building

props.synopsis: A garment that appears to be of Chinese origin is currently displayed in front of the South Korean flag at the Australian War Memorial — something Korean Australians are demanding is rectified.

title.children: Korean community call on Australian War Memorial to fix 'misleading' display

image.altText: headshot of a man with black hair and grey shirt

props.synopsis: A former CIA official has pleaded guilty to leaking top secret US intelligence documents about Israeli plans for a retaliatory strike on Iran.

title.children: Ex-CIA analyst pleads guilty to leaking info on Israeli attack on Iran

image.altText: Florence Pugh and Andrew Garfield laugh while walking through a park.

props.synopsis: With quirky humour, a perilous meet-cute and some tragic twists, We Live in Time is a worthy addition to the pantheon of weepy rom-coms.

title.children: We Live in Time shows the real joys and dramas of modern dating

image.altText: Crews clean up red paint splashed at a house in Dover Heights in an anti-Semitic attack

props.synopsis: On Friday, anti-Semitic graffiti was reported in Sydney. Hours later, Islamophobic graffiti was found. Jewish historians say the trend is in line with a complex issue underlying Australian society.

title.children: As discriminatory vandalism sweeps Australia, what's behind this trend?

image.altText: Joe Biden sits at a desk, with flags, framed photos and gold curtains in the background.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's presidency has featured some notable successes, a series of blunders and plain bad luck.

title.children: Wins, gaffes and miscalculations: Reflecting on Joe Biden's presidency

image.altText: Trees fallen on a suburban road

props.synopsis: The NSW SES is responding to more than 100 calls for assistance per hour as damaging winds and heavy rainfall continue to hit across the state.

title.children: Wave of storms pounding NSW declared natural disaster, unlocks relief payments

image.altText: A truffle chocolate after being dipped in a big tub of melted chocolate. Excess is dripping off it

props.synopsis: Chocolate is a dessert favourite but how much do you know about how it's made?

title.children: Got a sweet tooth? Try our chocolate quiz

image.altText: Part of a house on it's side between other properties.

props.synopsis: After a $2 million property lay in a splintered heap near the foot of a Mornington Peninsula hill on Tuesday, questions have been raised about the long-term viability of home lending and insurance for hilltop neighbourhoods.

title.children: This Victorian hillside home sold for $2 million. Now it lies in splinters

image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: There are dozens of cryptocurrency ATMs in the Canberra region, located across the city and outside it — but what are they for, how have they become so prolific, and who uses them?

title.children: Crypto ATMs are multiplying. Here's what they're used for

image.altText: GettyImages-493340307

props.synopsis: Denis Law, the Scotsman who scored 237 goals in 404 appearances and won the 1968 European Cup with Manchester United, has died at the age of 84.

title.children: 'The King of the Stretford End': Last of Manchester United's 'Holy Trinity' dies as tributes pour in

image.altText: A rip current taken from an aerial view.

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for better education surrounding the perils of WA beaches to be included in tourism advertising.

title.children: Drownings at holiday hotspots raise calls for tourism marketing re-think

image.altText: A white serving bowl filled with brown rice salad with feta cheese, chopped herbs and a quick pickled dressing.

props.synopsis: Shop your pantry to make this easy herby rice salad for weeknight dinners or work lunches.

title.children: A fast and flavourful rice salad made from pantry staples

image.altText: Image of red Tasmanian cherries next to a box of ripe lychees.

props.synopsis: Australian fruit producers are gearing up for Lunar New Year. At the centre of these celebrations are North Queensland lychees and Tasmanian cherries, which serve as symbols of prosperity and good fortune in Asian culture.

title.children: Why Lunar New Year has driven up fruit prices
